member.name: T:AttachedCommandBehavior.DelegateCommand
member.summary: Provides a base class for WPF commands.

member.name: P:AttachedCommandBehavior.DelegateCommand.CanExecuteDelegate
member.summary: Gets or sets the Predicate to execute when the CanExecute of the command gets called

member.name: P:AttachedCommandBehavior.DelegateCommand.ExecuteDelegate
member.summary: Gets or sets the action to be called when the Execute method of the command gets called

member.name: M:AttachedCommandBehavior.DelegateCommand.CanExecute(System.Object)
member.summary: Checks if the command Execute method can run
member.param: THe command parameter to be passed
member.returns: Returns true if the command can execute. By default true is returned so that if the user of SimpleCommand does not specify a CanExecuteCommand delegate the command still executes.

member.name: M:AttachedCommandBehavior.DelegateCommand.Execute(System.Object)
member.summary: Executes the actual command
member.param: THe command parameter to be passed

member.name: M:AttachedCommandBehavior.DelegateCommand`1.CanExecute(`0)
member.summary: Checks if the command Execute method can run
member.param: THe command parameter to be passed
member.returns: Returns true if the command can execute. By default true is returned so that if the user of SimpleCommand does not specify a CanExecuteCommand delegate the command still executes.

member.name: T:AttachedCommandBehavior.EventHandlerGenerator
member.summary: Generates delegates according to the specified signature on runtime

member.name: M:AttachedCommandBehavior.EventHandlerGenerator.CreateDelegate(System.Type,System.Reflection.MethodInfo,System.Object)
member.summary: Generates a delegate with a matching signature of the supplied eventHandlerType This method only supports Events that have a delegate of type void
member.param: The delegate type to wrap. Note that this must always be a void delegate
The object where the method resides
member.returns: Returns a delegate with the same signature as eventHandlerType that calls the methodToInvoke inside
